document.discussion_title: BTG plc (BTG) Stock Rating Reaffirmed by JPMorgan Chase & Co.
document.topic_text: Tweet JPMorgan Chase & Co. reissued their neutral rating on shares of BTG plc (LON:BTG) in a research report report published on Tuesday morning. The firm currently has a GBX 790 ($10.17) target price on the stock. Shares of BTG plc ( LON:BTG ) opened at 631.00 on Tuesday. The company’s market capitalization is GBX 2.42 billion. BTG plc has a 52-week low of GBX 504.00 and a 52-week high of GBX 739.50. The stock’s 50 day moving average price is GBX 665.21 and its 200-day moving average price is GBX 636.17. Other research analysts have also issued research reports about the company. Deutsche Bank AG restated a buy rating and issued a GBX 740 ($9.53) target price on shares of BTG plc in a report on Friday, June 24th. Panmure Gordon reiterated a buy rating and set a GBX 800 ($10.30) price target on shares of BTG plc in a report on Tuesday, May 17th. Jefferies Group reiterated a buy rating and set a GBX 850 ($10.95) price target on shares of BTG plc in a report on Tuesday, May 17th. Stifel Nicolaus reiterated a buy rating on shares of BTG plc in a report on Friday, June 24th. Finally, Numis Securities Ltd reiterated a hold rating and set a GBX 654 ($8.42) price target on shares of BTG plc in a report on Friday, June 24th. Four research analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and four have given a buy rating to the company’s stock. The stock presently has a consensus rating of Buy and a consensus price target of GBX 753.63 ($9.70). In other news, insider Soderstrom,Rolf sold 74,327 shares of BTG plc stock in a transaction on Thursday, July 21st. The stock was sold at an average price of GBX 676 ($8.70), for a total value of £502,450.52 ($646,987.54). Also, insider Makin,Dame Pamela Louise sold 256,404 shares of BTG plc stock in a transaction on Wednesday, July 6th. The shares were sold at an average price of GBX 695 ($8.95), for a total value of £1,782,007.80 ($2,294,627.61). BTG plc is a specialist healthcare company. The Company operates in three business segments: Interventional Medicine (IM) (oncology, vascular and pulmonology products), Specialty Pharmaceuticals (antidote products) and Licensing (royalties from licensed assets). The Company’s Interventional Medicine segment offers a portfolio of interventional medicine products that are designed to advance the treatment of liver tumors, advanced emphysema, severe blood clots and varicose veins.
